Group all files by year and month based on modification date
Shell script: for file in *; do [ -f \"$file\" ] || continue; year=$(date -r \"$file\" +\"%Y\"); month=$(date -r \"$file\" +\"%b\"); mkdir -p \"$year/$month\"; mv \"$file\" \"$year/$month/\"; done"

Group all MP4 files based on their creation date into year/month folders
Shell script: find . -type f -iname "*.mp4" -exec bash -c 'for f; do dir=$(date -r "$f" "+%Y/%B" | tr "[:upper:]" "[:lower:]"); mkdir -p "$dir"; mv "$f" "$dir/"; done' bash {} +

Group all MOV files based on their creation date into year/month folders
Shell script: find . -type f -iname "*.mov" -exec bash -c 'for f; do dir=$(date -r "$f" "+%Y/%B" | tr "[:upper:]" "[:lower:]"); mkdir -p "$dir"; mv "$f" "$dir/"; done' bash {} +

English understanding: Rename all image and video files in the current directory using the format YYYY_MM_DD.<ext>"
Shell script: for f in *.{jpg,jpeg,png,mp4,mov}; do ext=\${f##*.}\"; date=$(date -r \"$f\" +\"%Y_%m_%d\"); mv \"$f\" \"${date}.${ext}\"; done"

English understanding: Rename the file IMG_0001.JPG to its date format"
Rename the file video123.MOV based on its date as YYYY_MM_DD.MOV"
Rename all .jpg files to their date format"
Shell script: for f in *.jpg; do ext=\${f##*.}\"; date=$(date -r \"$f\" +\"%Y_%m_%d\"); mv \"$f\" \"${date}.${ext}\"; done"

English understanding: Rename all .mp4 files in the directory using their creation date"
Shell script: for f in *.mp4; do ext=\${f##*.}\"; date=$(date -r \"$f\" +\"%Y_%m_%d\"); mv \"$f\" \"${date}.${ext}\"; done"

English understanding: Rename all .mov files in the directory using their creation date"
Shell script: for f in *.mov; do ext=\${f##*.}\"; date=$(date -r \"$f\" +\"%Y_%m_%d\"); mv \"$f\" \"${date}.${ext}\"; done"
